messages.title: Putting the economy back on track
messages.content: The economy is growing again but we're not out of the woods yet. We've all felt the credit crunch – be it redundancy, pay freezes or worries about paying the mortgage. Labour will invest in Britain over the next four years to protect jobs until the economy is well into recovery.

messages.title: A new school for North Kingston
messages.content: Labour will spend £30 million on a new secondary school for North Kingston, so that local children can go to a nearby school. Labour will invest in education, even in hard times. Our children's education cannot be put on hold.

messages.title: Labour's committed to 4,500 cheap homes in Richmond - Here!
messages.content: Eleanor Tunnicliffe and Labour committed to developing affordable housing.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Invest in Britain to protect jobs and support economic recovery over the next four years.
Spend £30 million on a new secondary school for North Kingston and invest in education even in hard times.
Committed to 4,500 cheap homes in Richmond.

mentions.tacticalSituation: This election could be close. The Lib Dems refuse to rule out propping up a Tory government. Only the way to keep our jobs, our schools and our hospitals safe from Tory cuts is to vote Labour.

issues.economy: The economy is growing again but we're not out of the woods yet.
issues.education: Labour will spend £30 million on a new secondary school for North Kingston.
issues.socialWelfare: Eleanor hears how the Winter Fuel Allowance has helped pensioners.

housing.content: Labour's committed to 4,500 cheap homes in Richmond.

leaflet.personalStatement: "Richmond is a beautiful area to live in but the uncertainties of the credit crunch make us worried about tomorrow. Vote Labour to secure the recovery protect our homes, our schools, our hospitals, our future."

images.caption: Eleanor with local campaigners at the new school site.
Eleanor hears how the Winter Fuel Allowance has helped pensioners.
Labour's commitment to 4,500 cheap homes in Richmond visualized.
